tasks: Analysis of invariant random equivalence relations on groups
results: Characterization of exactness of a countable group in terms of invariant random equivalence relations
Amenability of restricted rerooting relation associated to the ideal Bernoulli Voronoi tessellation
title: Exactness and the Topology of the Space of Invariant Random Equivalence Relations.pdf
abstract: . We characterize exactness of a countable group Γ in terms of invariant random equivalence relations (IREs) on Γ. Speciﬁcally, we show that Γ is exact if and only if every weak limit of ﬁnite IREs is an amenable IRE. In particular, for exact groups this implies amenability of the restricted rerooting relation associated to the ideal Bernoulli Voronoi tessellation, the discrete analog of the ideal Poisson Voronoi tesselation. Introduction Invariant random equivalence relations (IREs) on groups were ﬁrst introduced by Tucker- Drob [TD13] and later studied by Kechris [Kec17]. Let Γ be a countable discrete group and let E ⊂2Γ×Γ denote the standard Borel space of equivalence relations on Γ. An invariant random equivalence relation (IRE) is a Borel probability measure ρ on E which is invariant under the left shift action Γ ↷E. A ﬁnite IRE is an IRE ρ such that ρ-almost every equivalence relation has only ﬁnite classes. 1
